types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been soft-deleted.

inputFields.name: site
inputFields.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

inputFields.name: siteId
inputFields.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

inputFields.description: Determines whether only elements with unique IDs should be returned by the query.

inputFields.description: Determines which site should be selected when querying multi-site elements.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ titles.

inputFields.name: slug
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ slugs.

inputFields.name: uri
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ URIs.

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that match a search query.

inputFields.name: relatedTo
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to the provided element IDs. This argument is ignored, if `relatedToAll` is also used.

inputFields.name: relatedToAssets
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an asset list defined with this argument.

inputFields.name: relatedToEntries
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an entry list defined with this argument.

inputFields.name: relatedToUsers
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a use list defined with this argument.

inputFields.name: relatedToCategories
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

inputFields.name: relatedToTags
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

inputFields.name: relatedToAll
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

inputFields.name: ref
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

inputFields.name: fixedOrder
inputFields.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

inputFields.name: inReverse
inputFields.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

inputFields.name: dateCreated
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

inputFields.name: dateUpdated
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

inputFields.name: offset
inputFields.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

inputFields.name: limit
inputFields.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

inputFields.name: orderBy
inputFields.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the volumes the assets belong to, per the volumes’ IDs.

inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the volumes the assets belong to, per the volumes’ handles.

inputFields.name: folderId
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the folders the assets belong to, per the folders’ IDs.

inputFields.name: filename
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ filenames.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ file kinds.

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ image heights.

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ image widths.

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ file sizes (in bytes).

inputFields.name: dateModified
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ files’ last-modified dates.

inputFields.name: hasAlt
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the assets have alternative text.

inputFields.name: includeSubfolders
inputFields.description: Broadens the query results to include assets from any of the subfolders of the folder specified by `folderId`.

inputFields.name: withTransforms
inputFields.description: A list of transform handles to preload.

inputFields.name: uploader
inputFields.description: Narrows the query results based on the user the assets were uploaded by, per the user’s ID.

args.name: relatedToCategories
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToTags
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToAll
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

args.name: ref
args.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

args.name: fixedOrder
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

args.name: inReverse
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

args.name: dateCreated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

args.name: dateUpdated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

args.name: offset
args.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: withStructure
args.description: Explicitly determines whether the query should join in the structure data.

args.name: structureId
args.description: Determines which structure data should be joined into the query.

args.name: level
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ level within the structure.

args.name: hasDescendants
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements have any descendants in their structure.

args.name: ancestorOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.name: type
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry type handles.

args.name: typeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry types, per the types’ IDs.

args.name: authorId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ authors.

args.name: authorGroup
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to.

args.name: authorGroupId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to, per the groups’ IDs.

args.name: postDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ post dates.

args.name: before
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: after
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted on or after a certain date.

args.name: expiryDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ expiry dates.

fields.name: canonicalId
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical ID.

fields.name: canonicalUid
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical UUID.

fields.name: sourceId
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical ID.
fields.deprecationReason: this field has been deprecated since Craft 3.7.7. Use `canonicalId` instead.

fields.name: sourceUid
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical UUID.
fields.deprecationReason: this field has been deprecated since Craft 3.7.7. Use `canonicalUid` instead.

fields.name: sectionId
fields.description: The ID of the section that contains the entry.

fields.name: sectionHandle
fields.description: The handle of the section that contains the entry.

fields.name: typeId
fields.description: The ID of the entry type that contains the entry.

fields.name: typeHandle
fields.description: The handle of the entry type that contains the entry.

fields.name: postDate
fields.description: The entry’s post date.

fields.name: expiryDate
fields.description: The expiry date of the entry.

fields.name: children
fields.description: The entry’s children, if the section is a structure. Accepts the same arguments as the `entries` query.

args.name: id
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ IDs.

args.name: uid
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ UIDs.

args.name: drafts
args.description: Whether draft elements should be returned.

args.name: draftOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only drafts of a given element.  Set to `false` to fetch unpublished drafts.

args.name: draftId
args.description: The ID of the draft to return (from the `drafts` table)

args.name: draftCreator
args.description: The drafts’ creator ID

args.name: provisionalDrafts
args.description: Whether provisional drafts should be returned.

args.name: revisions
args.description: Whether revision elements should be returned.

args.name: revisionOf
args.description: The source element ID that revisions should be returned for

args.name: revisionId
args.description: The ID of the revision to return (from the `revisions` table)

args.name: revisionCreator
args.description: The revisions’ creator ID

args.name: status
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ statuses.

args.name: archived
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been archived.

args.name: trashed
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been soft-deleted.

args.name: site
args.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

args.name: siteId
args.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

args.name: unique
args.description: Determines whether only elements with unique IDs should be returned by the query.

args.name: preferSites
args.description: Determines which site should be selected when querying multi-site elements.

args.name: title
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ titles.

args.name: slug
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ slugs.

args.name: uri
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ URIs.

args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that match a search query.

args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to the provided element IDs. This argument is ignored, if `relatedToAll` is also used.

args.name: unique
args.description: Determines whether only elements with unique IDs should be returned by the query.

args.name: preferSites
args.description: Determines which site should be selected when querying multi-site elements.

args.name: title
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ titles.

args.name: slug
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ slugs.

args.name: uri
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ URIs.

args.name: search
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that match a search query.

args.name: relatedTo
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to the provided element IDs. This argument is ignored, if `relatedToAll` is also used.

args.name: relatedToAssets
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an asset list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToEntries
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an entry list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToUsers
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a use list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToCategories
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToTags
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToAll
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

args.name: ref
args.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

args.name: fixedOrder
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

args.name: inReverse
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

args.name: dateCreated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

args.name: dateUpdated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

args.name: offset
args.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: ownerId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the addresses’ owners.

args.name: countryCode
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the addresses’ country codes.

args.name: administrativeArea
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the addresses’ administrative areas.

fields.name: addressCount
fields.description: This query is used to return the number of addresses.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: withStructure
args.description: Explicitly determines whether the query should join in the structure data.

args.name: structureId
args.description: Determines which structure data should be joined into the query.

args.name: level
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ level within the structure.

args.name: hasDescendants
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements have any descendants in their structure.

args.name: ancestorOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.name: type
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry type handles.

args.name: typeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry types, per the types’ IDs.

args.name: authorId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ authors.

args.name: authorGroup
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to.

args.name: authorGroupId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to, per the groups’ IDs.

args.name: postDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ post dates.

args.name: before
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: after
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted on or after a certain date.

args.name: expiryDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ expiry dates.

fields.description: This query is used to return the number of entries.

args.description: Determines which structure data should be joined into the query.

args.name: level
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ level within the structure.

args.name: hasDescendants
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements have any descendants in their structure.

args.name: ancestorOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.name: type
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry type handles.

args.name: typeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry types, per the types’ IDs.

args.name: authorId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ authors.

args.name: authorGroup
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to.

args.name: authorGroupId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to, per the groups’ IDs.

args.name: postDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ post dates.

args.name: before
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: after
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted on or after a certain date.

args.name: expiryDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ expiry dates.

args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: after

args.name: expiryDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ expiry dates.

fields.name: canonicalId
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical ID.

fields.name: canonicalUid
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical UUID.

fields.name: sourceId

fields.deprecationReason: this field has been deprecated since Craft 3.7.7. Use `canonicalId` instead.

fields.name: sourceUid
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical UUID.
fields.deprecationReason: this field has been deprecated since Craft 3.7.7. Use `canonicalUid` instead.

fields.name: sectionId
fields.description: The ID of the section that contains the entry.

fields.name: sectionHandle
fields.description: The handle of the section that contains the entry.

fields.name: typeId
fields.description: The ID of the entry type that contains the entry.

fields.name: typeHandle
fields.description: The handle of the entry type that contains the entry.

fields.name: postDate
fields.description: The entry’s post date.

fields.name: expiryDate
fields.description: The expiry date of the entry.

fields.name: children
fields.description: The entry’s children, if the section is a structure. Accepts the same arguments as the `entries` query.

args.description: Determines which site should be selected when querying multi-site elements.

args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ titles.

args.name: search
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that match a search query.

args.name: relatedTo
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to the provided element IDs. This argument is ignored, if `relatedToAll` is also used.

args.name: relatedToAssets
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an asset list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToEntries
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an entry list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToUsers
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a use list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToCategories
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToTags
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToAll
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

args.name: ref
args.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

args.name: fixedOrder
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

args.name: inReverse
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

args.name: dateCreated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

args.name: dateUpdated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

args.name: offset
args.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: withStructure
args.description: Explicitly determines whether the query should join in the structure data.

args.name: structureId
args.description: Determines which structure data should be joined into the query.

args.name: level
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ level within the structure.

args.name: hasDescendants
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements have any descendants in their structure.

args.name: ancestorOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.name: type
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry type handles.

args.name: typeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry types, per the types’ IDs.

args.name: authorId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ authors.

args.name: authorGroup
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to.

args.name: authorGroupId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to, per the groups’ IDs.

args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ post dates.

args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: id
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ IDs.

args.name: uid
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ UIDs.

args.name: drafts
args.description: Whether draft elements should be returned.

args.name: draftOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only drafts of a given element.  Set to `false` to fetch unpublished drafts.

args.name: draftId
args.description: The ID of the draft to return (from the `drafts` table)

args.name: draftCreator
args.description: The drafts’ creator ID

args.name: provisionalDrafts
args.description: Whether provisional drafts should be returned.

args.name: revisions
args.description: Whether revision elements should be returned.

args.name: revisionOf
args.description: The source element ID that revisions should be returned for

args.name: revisionId
args.description: The ID of the revision to return (from the `revisions` table)

args.name: revisionCreator
args.description: The revisions’ creator ID

args.name: status
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ statuses.

args.name: archived
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been archived.

args.name: trashed
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been soft-deleted.

args.name: site
args.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

args.name: siteId
args.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

args.name: unique
args.description: Determines whether only elements with unique IDs should be returned by the query.

args.name: preferSites
args.description: Determines which site should be selected when querying multi-site elements.

args.name: title
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ titles.

args.name: slug
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ slugs.

args.name: uri
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ URIs.

args.name: search
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that match a search query.

args.name: relatedTo
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to the provided element IDs. This argument is ignored, if `relatedToAll` is also used.

args.name: relatedToAssets
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an asset list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToEntries
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an entry list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToUsers
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a use list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToCategories
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToTags
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToAll
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

args.name: ref
args.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

args.name: fixedOrder
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

args.name: inReverse
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

args.name: dateCreated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

args.name: dateUpdated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

args.name: offset
args.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: withStructure
args.description: Explicitly determines whether the query should join in the structure data.

args.name: structureId
args.description: Determines which structure data should be joined into the query.

args.name: level
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ level within the structure.

args.name: hasDescendants
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements have any descendants in their structure.

args.name: ancestorOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.name: type
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry type handles.

args.name: typeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry types, per the types’ IDs.

args.name: authorId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ authors.

args.name: authorGroup
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to.

args.name: authorGroupId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to, per the groups’ IDs.

args.name: postDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ post dates.

args.name: before
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: after
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted on or after a certain date.

args.name: expiryDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ expiry dates.

args.description: Whether draft elements should be returned.

args.name: draftOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only drafts of a given element.  Set to `false` to fetch unpublished drafts.

args.name: draftId
args.description: The ID of the draft to return (from the `drafts` table)

args.name: draftCreator
args.description: The drafts’ creator ID

args.name: provisionalDrafts
args.description: Whether provisional drafts should be returned.

args.name: revisions
args.description: Whether revision elements should be returned.

args.name: revisionOf
args.description: The source element ID that revisions should be returned for

args.name: revisionId
args.description: The ID of the revision to return (from the `revisions` table)

args.name: revisionCreator
args.description: The revisions’ creator ID

args.name: status
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ statuses.

args.name: archived
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been archived.

args.name: trashed
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that have been soft-deleted.

args.name: site
args.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

args.name: siteId
args.description: Determines which site(s) the elements should be queried in. Defaults to the current (requested) site.

args.name: unique
args.description: Determines whether only elements with unique IDs should be returned by the query.

args.name: preferSites
args.description: Determines which site should be selected when querying multi-site elements.

args.name: title
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ titles.

args.name: slug
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ slugs.

args.name: uri
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ URIs.

args.name: search
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that match a search query.

args.name: relatedTo
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to the provided element IDs. This argument is ignored, if `relatedToAll` is also used.

args.name: relatedToAssets
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an asset list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToEntries
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to an entry list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToUsers
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a use list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToCategories
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToTags
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToAll
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

args.name: ref
args.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

args.name: fixedOrder
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

args.name: inReverse
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

args.name: dateCreated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

args.name: dateUpdated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

args.name: offset
args.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: withStructure
args.description: Explicitly determines whether the query should join in the structure data.

args.name: structureId
args.description: Determines which structure data should be joined into the query.

args.name: level
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ level within the structure.

args.name: hasDescendants
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements have any descendants in their structure.

args.name: ancestorOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are ancestors of another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: ancestorDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: descendantOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are descendants of another element in its structure provided by its ID.

args.name: descendantDist
args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `descendantOf`.

args.name: leaves
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the elements are “leaves” in their structure (element with no descendants).

args.name: nextSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: prevSiblingOf
args.description: Narrows the query results to only the entry that comes immediately before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedAfter
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned after another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: positionedBefore
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that are positioned before another element in its structure, provided by its ID.

args.name: editable
args.description: Whether to only return entries that the user has permission to edit.

args.name: section
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the section handles the entries belong to.

args.name: sectionId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the sections the entries belong to, per the sections’ IDs.

args.name: type
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry type handles.

args.name: typeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ entry types, per the types’ IDs.

args.name: authorId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ authors.

args.name: authorGroup
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to.

args.name: authorGroupId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user group the entries’ authors belong to, per the groups’ IDs.

args.name: postDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ post dates.

args.name: before
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted before a certain date.

args.name: after
args.description: Narrows the query results to only entries that were posted on or after a certain date.

args.name: expiryDate
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the entries’ expiry dates.

fields.name: canonicalId
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical ID.

fields.name: canonicalUid
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical UUID.

fields.name: sourceId
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical ID.
fields.deprecationReason: this field has been deprecated since Craft 3.7.7. Use `canonicalId` instead.

fields.name: sourceUid
fields.description: Returns the entry’s canonical UUID.
fields.deprecationReason: this field has been deprecated since Craft 3.7.7. Use `canonicalUid` instead.

fields.name: sectionHandle
fields.description: The handle of the section that contains the entry.

fields.name: typeId
fields.description: The ID of the entry type that contains the entry.

fields.name: typeHandle
fields.description: The handle of the entry type that contains the entry.

fields.name: postDate
fields.description: The entry’s post date.

fields.name: expiryDate
fields.description: The expiry date of the entry.

fields.name: children
fields.description: The entry’s children, if the section is a structure. Accepts the same arguments as the `entries` query.

args.description: Narrows the query results to only elements that are up to a certain distance away from the element in its structure specified by `ancestorOf`.

args.name: relatedToUsers
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a use list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToCategories
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a category list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToTags
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to a tag list defined with this argument.

args.name: relatedToAll
args.description: Narrows the query results to elements that relate to *all* of the provided element IDs. Using this argument will cause `relatedTo` argument to be ignored. **This argument is deprecated.** `relatedTo: ["and", ...ids]` should be used instead.

args.name: ref
args.description: Narrows the query results based on a reference string.

args.name: fixedOrder
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in the order specified by the `id` argument.

args.name: inReverse
args.description: Causes the query results to be returned in reverse order.

args.name: dateCreated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ creation dates.

args.name: dateUpdated
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the elements’ last-updated dates.

args.name: offset
args.description: Sets the offset for paginated results.

args.name: limit
args.description: Sets the limit for paginated results.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sets the field the returned elements should be ordered by.

args.name: siteSettingsId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the unique identifier for an element-site relation.

args.name: volumeId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the volumes the assets belong to, per the volumes’ IDs.

args.name: volume
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the volumes the assets belong to, per the volumes’ handles.

args.name: folderId
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the folders the assets belong to, per the folders’ IDs.

args.name: filename
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ filenames.

args.name: kind
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ file kinds.

args.name: height
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ image heights.

args.name: width
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ image widths.

args.name: size
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ file sizes (in bytes).

args.name: dateModified
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the assets’ files’ last-modified dates.

args.name: hasAlt
args.description: Narrows the query results based on whether the assets have alternative text.

args.name: includeSubfolders
args.description: Broadens the query results to include assets from any of the subfolders of the folder specified by `folderId`.

args.name: withTransforms
args.description: A list of transform handles to preload.

args.name: uploader
args.description: Narrows the query results based on the user the assets were uploaded by, per the user’s ID.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: formatDateTime
directives.description: Formats a date in the desired format. Can be applied to all fields, only changes output of DateTime fields.

args.name: format
args.description: The format to use. Can be `short`, `medium`, `long`, `full`, an [ICU date format](http://userguide.icu-project.org/formatparse/datetime), or a [PHP date format](https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.date.php). Defaults to the [Atom date time format](https://www.php.net/manual/en/class.datetimeinterface.php#datetime.constants.atom]).

args.name: timezone
args.description: The full name of the timezone (e.g., America/New_York). Defaults to UTC if no timezone set on the field.

args.name: locale
args.description: The locale to use when formatting the date. (E.g., en-US)

directives.name: markdown
directives.description: Parses the passed field value as Markdown.

args.name: flavor
args.description: The “flavor” of Markdown the input should be interpreted with. Accepts the same arguments as yii\helpers\Markdown::process().

args.name: inlineOnly
args.description:
Whether to only parse inline elements, omitting any `

` tags.

directives.name: money
directives.description: Formats a money object to the desired format. It can be applied to any fields, but only changes a Money field.

args.name: format
args.description: This specifies the format to output. This can be `amount`, `decimal`, `number`, or `string`. It defaults to the `string`.

args.name: locale
args.description: The locale to use when formatting the money value. (e.g. `en_US`). This argument is only valid with `number` and `string` formats.

directives.name: parseRefs
directives.description: Parses the element references on the field.

directives.name: transform
directives.description: Returns a URL for an [asset transform](https://craftcms.com/docs/4.x/image-transforms.html). Accepts the same arguments you would use for a transform in Craft.

args.name: handle
args.description: The handle of the named transform to use.

args.name: transform
args.description: The handle of the named transform to use.

args.name: width
args.description: Width for the generated transform

args.name: height
args.description: Height for the generated transform

args.name: mode
args.description: The mode to use for the generated transform.

args.name: position
args.description: The position to use when cropping, if no focal point specified.

args.name: interlace
args.description: The interlace mode to use for the transform

args.name: quality
args.description: The quality of the transform

args.name: format
args.description: The format to use for the transform

args.name: immediately
args.description: [_Deprecated_] This argument is deprecated and has no effect.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
